shortdesc.ph: Reports the result of taking a video snapshot.

p.codeblock: public void onSnapshotTaken(int uid, String filePath, int width, int height, int errCode) {}
onSnapshotTaken?( connection: RtcConnection, uid: number, filePath: string, width: number, height: number, errCode: number ): void;
public virtual void OnSnapshotTaken(RtcConnection connection, uint uid, string filePath, int width, int height, int errCode) { }
onSnapshotTaken?( connection: RtcConnection, uid: number, filePath: string, width: number, height: number, errCode: number ): void;
final void Function(RtcConnection connection, int uid, String filePath, int width, int height, int errCode)? onSnapshotTaken;

section.p: After a successful method call, the SDK triggers this callback to report whether the snapshot is successfully taken as well as the details for the snapshot taken.

plentry.pd: The user ID. One uid of 0 indicates the local user.
The local path of the snapshot.

The message that confirms success or gives the reason why the snapshot is not successfully taken:
0: Success.
< 0: Failure:
-1: The SDK fails to write data to a file or encode a JPEG image.
-2: The SDK does not find the video stream of the specified user within one second after the method call succeeds. The possible reasons are: local capture stops, remote end stops publishing, or video data processing is blocked.
-3: Calling the method too frequently.
